duties_responsibilities.duty: Responsible for leadership and management of federal IDIQ contracts and task orders as well as stand-alone federal design contracts for major projects.
Leads development of project work plans, including internal budgets, schedule, work assignments, the process of technical development, and coordination of both in-house and out of house disciplines.
Assures that the Design Review and QC processes are effectively utilized.
Develops, monitors, and maintains external project budgets.
Documents and assures the execution of project goals.
Responsible for managing multi-discipline teams that provide technical guidance and design in all areas of work associated with facilities planning, design, construction, and operation.
Initiates and reviews invoices and assists in the collection of past due accounts receivable.
Responsible for project delivery include design-bid-build as well as design-build delivery as prime or lead A/E firm under a qualified design-builder.
Monitors and, as authorized, execute contract adjustments based upon modifications to scope.
Performs other related work as apparent or assigned.
Responsible for maintaining positive client relationships through an appropriate and timely mix of communications and personal involvement.
Assures that the Design Review and QC processes are effectively utilized.
Responsible for pursuing and performing the work that is secured.
Initiates and reviews invoices and assists in the collection of past due accounts receivable.
Responsible for leading and managing federal IDIQ contracts and task orders as well as stand-alone federal design contracts for major projects.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Bachelor of Architecture required; Master of Architecture degree preferred. Certification as a Project Management Professional is preferred.
